intro: Draba haynaldii, commonly known as Haynald's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Draba haynaldii has a compact growth form with basal leaves and is often found in high-altitude environments. It is adapted to cold climates and is capable of surviving in nutrient-poor soils.
